About.title: The Program
About.description: The Amazon Hacking program is a training initiative for students at CESUPA's School of Business, Technology, and Innovation - ARGO. It aims to connect companies committed to Amazonian sustainability, the local community and its traditional knowledge, with scientific and technological knowledge. The goal is to promote the bioeconomic development of the region from a global perspective.
About.goalsDescription: University students will develop impactful projects to solve complex problems based on challenges identified by the local residents themselves.

imersion.title: Educational Immersion
imersion.description: Create <colored>immersive experiences</colored> on islands and within communities for the students.

iteration.title: Market Interaction
iteration.description: Interrelationship between <colored>students</colored> and <colored>technology</colored> companies in the market.

innovation.title: Amazonian Innovation
innovation.description: Foster <colored>technological</colored> and <colored>entrepreneurial solutions</colored> in the Amazon region.

Editions.label: 3rd Edition
Editions.subtitle: Combú Knowledge: Developing an inclusive bioeconomy in the Amazon.
Editions.mainText1: Ilha do Combu is a river island located on the Guamá River, very close to Belém do Pará. It is home to approximately 2,200 inhabitants. Its economy is driven mainly by the extraction of products such as açaí, cocoa and cupuaçu.
Editions.mainText2: The island has been designated an Environmental Protection Area to preserve its rich biodiversity and faces challenges in tourism and infrastructure growth, especially in sanitation and waste management. These problems require careful solutions to maintain a balance between economic development and environmental sustainability.
Editions.retrospectiveText: Each edition of Amazon Hacking has contributed to the program's continued growth and positive impact on the biodiversity of the Amazon and its communities. Discover the achievements and challenges that marked our legacy.
